products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-watsonx-ai
products.label: Cloud automation for watsonx.ai
products.short_description: Creates and configures watsonx.ai Studio, watsonx.ai Runtime and watsonx.ai Project.
products.long_description: IBM watsonx.ai provides an enterprise-grade studio of integrated tools for developing AI services and deploying them into your applications of choice. This deployable architecture supports creating and configuring the instances of watsonx.ai Studio, watsonx.ai Runtime and creates a KMS encrypted watsonx.ai Project. It enables storage delegation for the Cloud Object Storage instance. For detailed information on IBM watsonx.ai, refer [here](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/getting-started/overview-wx.html?context=wx&audience=wdp#watsonxai).

features.title: watsonx.ai Studio
features.description: Provisions an instance of IBM Cloud [watsonx.ai Studio](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/svc-welcome/wsl.html?context=cpdaas) that provides the environment and tools for you to collaboratively work on data to solve your business problems.

features.title: watsonx.ai Runtime
features.description: This solution creates and configures an IBM [watsonx.ai Runtime](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/svc-welcome/wml.html?context=cpdaas) instance, enabling the execution of machine learning and foundation models.

features.title: watsonx.ai Project
features.description: Creates a starter watsonx.ai Project where you can work with data and other assets to align with your goals. [Learn more](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/manage-data/manage-projects.html?context=cpdaas).

features.title: Sets up user profile
features.description: Configures the watsonx.ai user profile with admin privileges for the created project. [Learn more](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/manage-data/admin-project.html?context=wx&audience=wdp&locale=en).

features.title: Object Storage
features.description: Supports the creation of an [Object Storage](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-object-storage?topic=cloud-object-storage-getting-started-cloud-object-storage) instance to link with your watsonx.ai project for assets storage.

features.title: KMS Encryption
features.description: Enables Key Management Service(KMS) encryption for the Object Storage used for watsonx.ai, enhancing data security. For more details on KMS encryption, refer [this](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/key-protect?topic=key-protect-about).

features.title: Optional Integrations
features.description: This solution can be integrated with [Cloud automation for Observability](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-observability-a3137d28-79e0-479d-8a24-758ebd5a0eab-global) that supports configuring resources for logging, monitoring and activity tracker event routing.

diagrams.description:
This deployable architecture Cloud automation of watsonx.ai provides a comprehensive suite of integrated tools for building generative AI and machine learning solutions. The architecture integrates multiple IBM Cloud services to ensure security, scalability, and ease of use. The key components of this solution are as follows.

watsonx.ai Studio & Runtime:
The solution configures both the watsonx.ai Studio for model development and the watsonx.ai Runtime for deployment, ensuring seamless integration across the lifecycle of AI applications.

Storage delegation:
This solution supports creating a Cloud Object Storage instance to store project's assets. You can provide an existing Object Storage instance details too. The architecture allows for storage delegation on the Cloud Object Storage instance. This feature enables non-administrative users to create and manage their own projects, platform assets, and corresponding storage buckets without requiring full administrative access.

KMS encryption:
To enhance the data security, this solution provisions the IBM Key Protect service and creates keys for a Key Management Service (KMS), for the Object Storage instance used by watsonx.ai. This setup ensures that all data within the watsonx.ai instance is encrypted.

User profile configuration:
The solution configures user profiles with specific roles and privileges. By setting up the watsonx.ai user profile with admin privileges for the created project, users are granted the necessary permissions to manage, monitor, and modify project settings as needed.

Observability:
It can be integrated with IBM Cloud Observability. [Cloud automation for Observability](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-observability-a3137d28-79e0-479d-8a24-758ebd5a0eab-global) provides advanced monitoring, logging, and operational insights into the performance and health of your watsonx.ai deployment.

This deployable architecture is designed to streamline the process of creating, securing, and managing AI-driven projects in the cloud. Upon successful deployment, you will receive a URL for your pre-configured watsonx.ai project, allowing you to immediately begin working based on your business needs.

configuration.description: When set to `true`, the IBM Cloud Monitoring instance will be configured to collect platform metrics from the provided region. You can configure 1 instance only of the IBM Cloud Monitoring service per region to collect platform metrics in that location. Check with the account or service administrator if another monitoring instance has already been configured. You may not have permissions to see all monitoring instances in the region. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-platform_metrics_enabling).

To manage platform logs that are generated by IBM Cloud services in a region of IBM Cloud, you must create a tenant in each region that you operate. Pass a list of regions to create a tenant in. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/logs-router?topic=logs-router-about-platform-logs).

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-account-infra-base
dependencies.description: Cloud automation for Account Configuration organizes your IBM Cloud account with a ready-made set of resource groups by default and, when you enable the "with Account Settings" option, it also applies baseline security and governance settings.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-kms
dependencies.description: Enable Cloud Automation for Key Protect when you want services to use your own managed encryption keys. If disabled, it will fall back on IBM Cloud's default service-managed encryption.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-cos
dependencies.description: Enable to create an IBM Cloud Object Storage(COS) instance to store files that are related to project's assets, including uploaded data files or notebook files.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-observability
dependencies.description: Configure IBM Cloud Logs, Cloud Monitoring and Activity Tracker event routing for analysing logs and metrics generated by the watsonx.ai instance.
